title: Compiler error happening regularly after using `cargo sqlx prepare` command

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
### Code What I did is running `cargo sqlx prepare` command, than changed branch with merge. Next, a docker image was compiled on a server without any problems. I've changed branch back to test a `/health` check bug running `cargo run` and than this happended. ```Rust cargo run // error cargo run --target aarch64-apple-darwin Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.14s Running `target/aarch64-apple-darwin/debug/backend` 2022-12-03T14:22:27.701659Z INFO backend: listening on 127.0.0.1:3000 ``` It's weird because `aarch64-apple-darwin` is my default target, error trace shows same target on `cargo run`. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.65.0 (897e37553 2022-11-02) binary: rustc commit-hash: 897e37553bba8b42751c67658967889d11ecd120 commit-date: 2022-11-02 host: aarch64-apple-darwin release: 1.65.0 LLVM version: 15.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Failed to extract DefId: local_def_id_to_hir_id cb39f3a9147bac67-2b0991f8d87e9526', compiler/rustc_middle/src/dep_graph/dep_node.rs:267:17 ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: 0x10118f670 - ::fmt::h2990a6f24ccff6db 1: 0x1011d9c34 - core::fmt::write::h91497fd291c8b104 2: 0x101182604 - std::io::Write::write_fmt::h23fa41342cffacf4 3: 0x101191eec - std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}::hb41cdb784f4c17ac 4: 0x101191c10 - std::panicking::default_hook::hdfe992d5fb29a991 5: 0x108ef6718 - rustc_driver[250dcea03822790c]::DEFAULT_HOOK::{closure#0}::{closure#0} 6: 0x1011925b0 - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::h2eb0e4b718773521 7: 0x10119245c - std::panicking::begin_panic_handler::{{closure}}::h06a693206403b4d5 8: 0x10118fad8 - std::sys_common::backtrace::__rust_end_short_backtrace::h8998defd518dbcad 9: 0x1011921b0 - _rust_begin_unwind 10: 0x1012036a4 - core::panicking::panic_fmt::ha46aa9af97eb193d 11: 0x10cbcbf94 - as rustc_middle[a5107c7538e61c53]::dep_graph::dep_node::DepNodeExt>::extract_def_id::{closure#0} 12: 0x10cba395c - ::def_path_hash_to_def_id 13: 0x10cbcbf14 - as rustc_middle[a5107c7538e61c53]::dep_graph::dep_node::DepNodeExt>::extract_def_id 14: 0x10c134450 - rustc_query_impl[ebd438b5e01d582b]::plumbing::force_from_dep_node:: 15: 0x10cb8f518 - ::try_force_from_dep_node 16: 0x10c08c610 - >::try_mark_previous_green:: 17: 0x10c08c5e0 - >::try_mark_previous_green:: 18: 0x10c05cdb0 - >::try_mark_green:: 19: 0x10be17cc4 - rustc_query_system[376554ccb6bbe62f]::query::plumbing::ensure_must_run:: 20: 0x10bf27b98 - rustc_query_system[376554ccb6bbe62f]::query::plumbing::get_query:: 21: 0x10b592264 - ::for_each_module:: 22: 0x10b5cd97c - ::time::<(), rustc_typeck[4423ce6fa4a8f5dd]::check_crate::{closure#6}> 23: 0x10b6c0558 - rustc_typeck[4423ce6fa4a8f5dd]::check_crate 24: 0x1090050f0 - rustc_interface[64ac8d545596c047]::passes::analysis 25: 0x10c0c20ec - >::with_task::> 26: 0x10bed0000 - rustc_query_system[376554ccb6bbe62f]::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::>> 27: 0x10bf3702c - rustc_query_system[376554ccb6bbe62f]::query::plumbing::get_query:: 28: 0x108f27054 - ::enter::> 29: 0x108efc1b4 - rustc_interface[64ac8d545596c047]::interface::create_compiler_and_run::, rustc_driver[250dcea03822790c]::run_compiler::{closure#1}> 30: 0x108f5f5e0 - >::set::, rustc_driver[250dcea03822790c]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core[75a5a00debbb3d3d]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[c8454b970e154417]::ErrorGuaranteed>> 31: 0x108f2adc8 - std[a5ccfe66677bd8c7]::sys_common::backtrace::__rust_begin_short_backtrace::, rustc_driver[250dcea03822790c]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core[75a5a00debbb3d3d]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[c8454b970e154417]::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#0}, core[75a5a00debbb3d3d]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[c8454b970e154417]::ErrorGuaranteed>> 32: 0x108f2dc4c - <::spawn_unchecked_, rustc_driver[250dcea03822790c]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core[75a5a00debbb3d3d]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[c8454b970e154417]::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#0}, core[75a5a00debbb3d3d]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[c8454b970e154417]::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#1} as core[75a5a00debbb3d3d]::ops::function::FnOnce<()>>::call_once::{shim:vtable#0} 33: 0x10119a428 - std::sys::unix::thread::Thread::new::thread_start::hf682c03d0f237892 34: 0x1a566606c - __pthread_deallocate error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.65.0 (897e37553 2022-11-02) running on aarch64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental=[REDACTED] note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```
